newsitem.title: UZBEKISTAN: Western Mining, Uzbekistan set up gold venture.
newsitem.headline: Western Mining, Uzbekistan set up gold venture.

text.p: Australia's Western Mining Corporation (WMC) will set up a joint venture with Uzbekistan to exploit its Zarmitan gold deposit, a WMC official said on Wednesday.

Jonathan Saunders, head of the WMC branch in Uzbekistan, told reporters the deposit, 90 km (56 miles) north-west of Samarkand, holds an estimated 24 million tonnes of auriferous ore containing 10 grams of gold per tonne.
Saunders said WMC, which won an investment tender in February this year, plans to build a gold processing plant with an upgraded purification system.

He did not provide data for the capital structure of the future joint venture and the expected production capacity of the plant, but said that WMC was planning to invest a total of roughly $100 million in the project.
The joint venture plans to produce an alloy containing 86 to 90 percent of gold with further purification at two Uzbek plants.
Further economic and technical studies will take another 18-24 months after necessary documents are signed, he said.
Uzbek President Islam Karimov has estimated his country's natural reserves of gold at 5,000 tonnes.
